text: A weka (Gallirallus australis), also known as the Maori hen or woodhen, is a flightless bird in the rail family. It is endemic to New Zealand. There are four subspecies. Weka are sturdy brown birds, about the size of a chicken. They feed mainly on invertebrates and fruit.Gill, Frank B. 2007. Ornithology. New York: Freeman, p. 30. ==References== Category:Birds of New Zealand Category:Rallidae Category:Flightless birds
title: Weka
